Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2018 08:26PM Bbccats wrote: Hello everyone. I had my first appointment with my radiation oncologist today. I will have my planning session on April 3rd and will likely start radiation 2 weeks later. I'm having 25 treatments. I'm happy to have found this group.
Posts.Title: April 2018- Starting Radiation LiMa66 PrincessButtercup

Posts.Content: May 24, 2018 12:03PM Bbccats wrote: Finished my last treatment today...25/25. It feels good to be finished. I’ve been told my skin will continue to get worse for at least the next couple of weeks. A nurse will call in a week to see how I am doing. I’m deep red and purple and they expect the skin to break open in a few places. They told me to put polysporin on the open parts. Thanks to everyone in this group for your support. Best wishes to all who are finished and finishing. Be well.
Posts.Title: April 2018- Starting Radiation LiMa66 PrincessButtercup

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2018 09:45AM - edited Mar 29, 2018 04:11PM by Bbccats Thanks for the welcome! poliwogli: Yes I have cats...three actually. Bellini, Bella and Caesar ...hence Bbccats. My cancer didn't show up on mammogram or the 3D mammogram either. It only showed on MRI. My mother's cancer never showed up on mammogram either. She found them each time herself. She lived for 22 years after her initial diagnosis.
Posts.Title: April 2018- Starting Radiation LiMa66 PrincessButtercup

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2018 05:48PM Bbccats wrote: I had my planning today and it was pretty easy. Just had to lay completely still for about 15 minutes total. I got four tiny tattoos. They gave me appointments for my first week. I start on April 17th and finish on May 22nd (25 treatments). Looking forward to counting them down.
Posts.Title: April 2018- Starting Radiation LiMa66 PrincessButtercup

Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2018 01:03PM Bbccats wrote: Princess Buttercup - You didn't fail at radiation. That way of doing radiation failed you. I'm glad they have now organized doing it another way. Best of luck tomorrow.
Posts.Title: April 2018- Starting Radiation LiMa66 PrincessButtercup

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2018 09:17AM Bbccats wrote: I had my 9th treatment on Friday and am beginning to get a bit pink. I have Wednesday off next week because they are working on the machine. I'm glad to have a little break although they add a day at the end. Most days I'm in and out of the hospital very quickly. Yesterday there was a delay so I was there for 2 hours. Ugh :(
Posts.Title: April 2018- Starting Radiation LiMa66 PrincessButtercup

Posts.Content: May 11, 2018 05:06PM Bbccats wrote: Treatment 18/25 today. I am pretty red and in some pain so my oncologist has started me on saline compresses. He was quite sympathetic and said he was sorry and ...it’s going to get worse. Hmmm the last part I could have done without. Oh well forewarned is forarmed. Happy to have the weekend break ahead. Hope everyone is doing well. For those who are finished, congratulations!!! For those of us that are continuing, we got this!!!

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2018 03:14PM Bbccats wrote: Paco - I hear you about the snow. This spring is ridiculous. I start radiation today.... a bit later today than I was expecting. They called to tell me the machine was down so I’m heading in 2 hours later than I thought. I’m so glad they called though because it saved my DD from taking the bus and subway home from high school. I like to pick her up when I can. Also nice to not have to sit and wait at the hospital. Hoping for no machine problems for everyone for the rest of the week. That’s probably too optimistic but we can hope.

Posts.Content: May 2, 2018 09:15PM - edited May 2, 2018 10:48PM by Bbccats I'm 11/25 today and definitely pink over the entire radiated area. So far no itching, swelling or pain. I apply Lubriderm four t9mes a day. That is what my oncologist recommended. LiMa66 - I know what you mean about being ambivalent about finishing treatments. It does feel good to be doing something concrete.
